content: I sincerely send my humble apology for sending a ? about deployement. It was I that was responsible for that. It was a Mom in a weak moment asking a dumb and foolish ?. Actually I thought I had put IF they were going to be deployed again. What I wrote and what I was thinking came out as one of the same. I would never do or mention anything that would put mine or someone else's soldier in harms way. That truely goes to show you that we should all go back and read the Forum Discussion Rules every once in a while. READING WHAT YOU WROTE BEFORE SENDING IT WOULD HAVE HELPED ALSO. bsk

content: I am a Mom. A 65 old Mom. My father served, my son is serving now. I was born while my father was serving years ago. I have pictures of me as a baby on one of the bases on the East Coast. At the time, I believe there was no base family housing. Not sure about that. I slept in a chester drawer. After that my father was deployed and didn't see him again for 2 years. I will go back and check my profile. That profile had to be years ago. At the time I joined this forum I had no one in the military but our family needed a lot of answers about joining. Don't think you want me now as a recruit unless I could babysit or be a cook.

content: Again, I apologize. I am filling out the profile right now. It has been a comfort as well as a security blanket for me and my family to have been a part of this forum for the last ?couple of years?. In the past through years, not only has this been a wonderful tool to cope with a son being gone but visitng so many bases all over the country to visit with him has helped. We have his little girl with us and she has had the experience of traveling with us to see her Dad. I hope that we will have the oportunity to visit again this summer. Being on the different bases and seeing how well trained our military is has been a real comfort and been a source of real PRIDE in our military. At least we have been able to see the results of where some of where our tax money goes that we aprove of. BSK

title: An Apology

content: Hi BKS, I want to welcome you to this strange family – military.com. The longer you stay the more you will like it. We all have one common bond – we love our military troops and their families. This is a 71 year old dad of a Coast Guard girl and two granddaughter in training right now, one USCG reserve training at Cape May and one in AF basic at Lackland. I’m more nervous. They are 26 and 24 with college degrees. I just talked to the CG girl and she’s home sick the AF girl called from and she loves it. Their mom is active duty CG and feeling an empty nest – she is crying. Worry is what parents and grandparents do best. There is a very true old saying, “They too serve who only, watch, wait and pray.” OAL God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans
